item.title: [508] Almost Full Runecrafting [508]
item.dc:creator: @Snackman Snackman
item.description:
@Snackman wrote:

great tutorial thanks im going to use this for sure

and btw: The commands are same for pali and bulby

.\Bulby\players\Player.java:42: cannot find symbol symbol : class runecrafting location: class Bulby.players.Player public runecrafting runecrafting = new runecrafting(); ^ .\Bulby\players\Player.java:42: cannot find symbol symbol : class runecrafting location: class Bulby.players.Player public runecrafting runecrafting = new runecrafting(); ^ 2 errors Press any key to continue . . .

hmm… this is with Berky Source… =/ If I remove that bit then I get:-
…


This could be fixing it, if not, I got another way but then my post would be too full :P:
You forgot to change the imports:
needgp isn’t declared in player.java if you use bulby change it to:
import Bulby.players.Player; IN runecrafting.java and give player.java: import Bulby.Skills.runeCrafting.runecrafting;

NOTE: check “Skills”. for pali bases, it’s WITHOUT capital ‘s’, but for bulby it is with capital.
so be sure to check EVERY import and EVERY package (both on top of the files) to see if it’s all spelled right.

I hope this helps some people out

Read full topic

item.title: [508] Almost Full Runecrafting [508]
item.dc:creator: @santaorb santaorb
item.description:
@santaorb wrote:

[508] Tutorial on Runecrafting With Pics [508]

[size=20pt]this is not mine but i posted it here cuz i dint seen it on the website
i got it from -**.org this is made by zack_flowers ![/size]

REMEMBER TO CHANGE IMPORTS TO THE SOURCE YOUR! USING.
REMEMBER TO CHANGE IMPORTS TO THE SOURCE YOUR! USING.

This is the complete Runecrafting setup, with Multiple runes, once you hit a certain level.

For example, once you hit 99 runecrafting, you’ll be making 10x air runes per essence.

Difficulty 1/10

Source: Pali/Bulby

Files Needed:
Player.java
Objectoption.java
runecrafting.java

Credits:
Me: 80%
Netbeans IDE: 20%

Go into your skills folder and make a new packet (or folder) and name it runeCrafting, like so.

2ylr9rk.png429×546

Now, go into your folder and add a new file named
runecrafting.java

2d849lg.png866×188

Open up your runecrafting.java and place this into it.

[code]package needgp.skills.runeCrafting;

import needgp.Engine;
import needgp.players.Player;

public class runecrafting {
private int ess;
public static void runecrafting(Player p, int level, int XP, int rune, int a2, int a3, int a4, int a5, int a6, int a7, int a8, int a9, int a10)
{
int ess = Engine.playerItems.invItemCount(p, 1436);
int lvl = 1;
p.clickId = p.stream.readUnsignedWord();
if (p.skillLvl[20] < lvl)
{
p.frames.sendMessage(p, “You need at least “+ lvl +” to runecraft this.”);
return;
}
if (!Engine.playerItems.haveItem(p, 1436)) {
p.frames.sendMessage(p, “you need Rune Essence to Craft this!”);
return;
}
if (p.skillLvl[20] >= lvl)
{
if (p.skillLvl[20] >= a2 && p.skillLvl[20] < a3)
ess = Engine.playerItems.invItemCount(p, 1436)*2;
if (p.skillLvl[20] >= a3 && p.skillLvl[20] < a4)
ess = Engine.playerItems.invItemCount(p, 1436)*3;
if (p.skillLvl[20] >= a4 && p.skillLvl[20] < a5)
ess = Engine.playerItems.invItemCount(p,1436)*4;
if (p.skillLvl[20] >= a5 && p.skillLvl[20] < a6)
ess = Engine.playerItems.invItemCount(p,1436)*5;
if (p.skillLvl[20] >= a6 && p.skillLvl[20] < a7)
ess = Engine.playerItems.invItemCount(p,1436)*6;
if (p.skillLvl[20] >= a7 && p.skillLvl[20] < a8)
ess = Engine.playerItems.invItemCount(p,1436)*7;
if (p.skillLvl[20] >= a8 && p.skillLvl[20] < a9)
ess = Engine.playerItems.invItemCount(p,1436)*8;
if (p.skillLvl[20] >= a9 && p.skillLvl[20] < a10)
ess = Engine.playerItems.invItemCount(p,1436)*9;
if (p.skillLvl[20] >= a10)
ess = Engine.playerItems.invItemCount(p,1436)*10;

	}
     for (int i = 0; i < 29; i++)
         Engine.playerItems.deleteItem(p, 1436, Engine.playerItems.getItemSlot(p,1436), i);
         Engine.playerItems.addItem(p, rune, ess);
         p.addSkillXP(XP*ess, 20);
         p.requestAnim(791, 0);

}
}[/code]

Now Save.

Guess I’ll try to explain it since people on here really don’t deserve this, I made this on Netbeans IDE, so i had some help, i can’t do this shit without netbeans :
int a2-a10 are the multiple rune levels, for example this is the mind rune altar setup.
p.runecrafting.runecrafting(p, 2, 35, 558, 14, 28, 42, 56, 70, 84, 98, 150, 150);
p = Player
2 = Level Required to Runecraft.
35 = Experience per rune essence.
558 = the rune you receive per ess.
14 = runecrafting lvl when you get 2x mind runes per ess
28 = runecrafting lvl when you get 3x mind runes per ess
42 = runecrafting lvl when you get 4x mind runes per ess
56 = runecrafting lvl when you get 5x mind runes per ess
70 = runecrafting lvl when you get 6x mind runes per ess
84 = runecrafting lvl when you get 7x mind runes per ess
98 = runecrafting lvl when you get 8x mind runes per ess
150 = Tried to put -1 to cancel out the 9x and 10x, but didn’t work :\ gave me like 20x runes for some reason, so i randomly picked 150 to see if it worked, and it did.

Cases 2479-2488 = Altar ObjectId’s
Cases 7129-7140 = Lift Object Id’s

At first, I tried to put p.runecrafting.runecraft for objcetoption1.java but it didn’t work, so i tried putting cases in both objectoption and runecrafting.java, and it worked, but I forgot that you need a declaration in objectoption1.java to get the objects to be handled, so i removed the cases in runecrafting.java and left em in objectoption1.java.

Now open up Objectoption1.java
Place these cases in your objectoption1.java

case 2479://mind altar { p.runecrafting.runecrafting(p, 2, 35, 558, 14, 28, 42, 56, 70, 84, 98, 150, 150); } break; case 2480: { p.runecrafting.runecrafting(p, 5, 40, 555, 19, 38, 57, 76, 95, 150, 150, 150, 150); } break; case 2481: { p.runecrafting.runecrafting(p, 9, 45, 557, 26, 52, 78, 150, 150, 150, 150, 150, 150); } break; case 2482: { p.runecrafting.runecrafting(p, 14, 50, 554, 35, 70, 150, 150, 150, 150, 150, 150, 150); } break; case 2483: { p.runecrafting.runecrafting(p, 20, 45, 559, 46, 92, 150, 150, 150, 150, 150, 150, 150); } break; case 2484: { p.runecrafting.runecrafting(p, 27, 65, 564, 59, 150, 150, 150, 150, 150, 150, 150, 150); } break; case 2485: { p.runecrafting.runecrafting(p, 54, 140, 563, 150, 150, 150, 150, 150, 150, 150, 150, 150); } break; case 2486: { p.runecrafting.runecrafting(p, 44, 120, 561, 91, 150, 150, 150, 150, 150, 150, 150, 150); } break; case 2487: { p.runecrafting.runecrafting(p, 35, 78, 562, 74, 150, 150, 150, 150, 150, 150, 150, 150); } break; case 2488: { p.runecrafting.runecrafting(p, 65, 150, 560, 150, 150, 150, 150, 150, 150, 150, 150, 150); } break; case 7134: //Chaos p.teleportTo(2281, 4837, 0, 4, 0, 8939, 8941, 1576, 0, 1577, 0); break; case 7135: //Law p.teleportTo(2464, 4818, 0, 4, 0, 8939, 8941, 1576, 0, 1577, 0); break; case 7136: //Death p.teleportTo(2208, 4830, 0, 4, 0, 8939, 8941, 1576, 0, 1577, 0); break; case 7137: //Water p.teleportTo(3494, 4831, 0, 4, 0, 8939, 8941, 1576, 0, 1577, 0); break; case 7138: //Astral p.teleportTo(2154, 3866, 0, 4, 0, 8939, 8941, 1576, 0, 1577, 0); break; case 7139: //Air p.teleportTo(2793, 4828, 0, 4, 0, 8939, 8941, 1576, 0, 1577, 0); break; case 7140: //Mind p.teleportTo(2793, 4828, 0, 4, 0, 8939, 8941, 1576, 0, 1577, 0); break; case 7131: //Body p.teleportTo(2521, 4834, 0, 4, 0, 8939, 8941, 1576, 0, 1577, 0); break; case 7130: //Earth p.teleportTo(2655, 4830, 0, 4, 0, 8939, 8941, 1576, 0, 1577, 0); break; case 7129: //Fire p.teleportTo(2577, 4845, 0, 4, 0, 8939, 8941, 1576, 0, 1577, 0); break; case 7132: //Cosmic p.teleportTo(2162, 4833, 0, 4, 0, 8939, 8941, 1576, 0, 1577, 0); break; case 7133: //Nature p.teleportTo(2400, 4835, 0, 4, 0, 8939, 8941, 1576, 0, 1577, 0); break;

Now above your switch statement, add this.

	runecrafting runecrafting = new runecrafting();

Now, add this import

import needgp.skills.runeCrafting.runecrafting;

Now Save objectoption.java

Now, open up player.java and add this under public class player {

public runecrafting runecrafting = new runecrafting();

Now, add this import to your player.java

import needgp.skills.runeCrafting.runecrafting;

Now save player.java

Now, open up npcoption1.java and add this case under your switch statement.

case 2258: p.teleportTo(3040, 4835, 0, 0, 0, 8939, 8941, 1576, 0, 1577, 0); break;

Now save your npcoption1.java

Next, open up your npcspawn.cfg
click bin folder -> data folder -> npc folder -> npcspawn.cfg and add this

spawn	=	2258	3104	3556	0	3107	3559	3102	3554	Mage Of Zamorak

Now save and compile.

You should have something like this once completed.

vd3eau.png781×545

2s6kne1.png784×547

b6x74g.png769×535

I know for a fact what everyone is going to say, “I don’t have that mapdata!”
Well, I’ll give you my 1218 files.
Here’s the URl Link.

http://uppit.com/v/5OBQ024G

My part!

normel u wont get any errors i tested it on 2 source’s
only i dont think that the zammy mage works on palidino starter source
but o well il give u a command for the tele

palidino tele:

if (cmd[0].equals("runecrafting")) { p.objects(); p.frames.sendMessage(p, "Welcome to Runecrafting abby's"); p.teleportTo(3040, 4835, 0, 4, 0, 8939, 8941, 1576, 0, 1577, 0); }

i dont have bulby command cuz i dont use bulby…

1.5´% to me for posting end command

[size=15pt]GL Whit RuneCrafting[/size]

Read full topic
